intro: Neobartlettia constipatiflora, commonly known as the compact-flowered neobartlettia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Neobartlettia constipatiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm climates.
